definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)

sentences.english: Some are like myself, working as a teacher, reading and writing, content with a simple life.
sentences.chinese: 有的和我一樣當教書先生，讀讀寫寫滿足簡樸的生活。

sentences.english: Think small, dream big. A simple space sparking off infinite possibilities.
sentences.chinese: “小劇場”的演出發生在一個簡樸的空間。

sentences.english: All this gracious living isn't for me, I prefer the simple life.
sentences.chinese: 這優裕的生活不適合我，我寧願過簡樸的生活。

sentences.english: When they tighten their belts, austerity ripples out and chokes growth.
sentences.chinese: 當他們束緊褲腰帶，簡樸生活會波及到經濟增長。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there was a Queen whose surname was Ma.
sentences.chinese: 從前有個皇后姓馬，她生活非常簡樸。

sentences.english: There was a huge cupboard , simple and beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 有一個大食櫥，簡樸而美觀。

sentences.english: Women have to be modestly dressed,no jewelry, saved through childbearing.
sentences.chinese: 女人必須衣着簡樸，不能戴首飾，通過生育得到救贖。

sentences.english: It gives me the peacefulness and simplicity that the city exhausts too easily.
sentences.chinese: 它讓我找到了容易在城市遺失的平靜跟簡樸。

sentences.english: Soft film ceiling maintenance is very simple, do not waste too much of your time.
sentences.chinese: 軟膜天花的保養實在很簡樸，不會鋪張你太多時間。

sentences.english: In the village there lived a simple, good man named Rip Van Winkle .
sentences.chinese: 村裏住着一位簡樸的好人，他的名字叫做李伯凡文克。

sentences.english: For a pure and honest simple dark-light.
He set us an example of plain living.
sentences.chinese: 他爲我們樹立了簡樸生活的榜樣。

sentences.english: But the classroom itself is austere.
sentences.chinese: 但是教室本身卻非常簡樸。

sentences.english: The moral of the story is that we simply don't know.
sentences.chinese: 這個故事的寄意是我們無法簡樸得知的。

sentences.english: It is the simplest reliable and easiest method to teach people including children.
sentences.chinese: 這很簡樸，可欣，輕易的理論去教人們，包括學生。

sentences.english: Hai Rui was an honest and upright official in the Ming Dynasty . He led a very simple life.
sentences.chinese: 海瑞斯明代的一個大清官，他生活也很簡樸。

definition: nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
to return to one's true self/to regain the natural state
simple and unadorned (of art, architecture etc)
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
